project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Say for example 2 RB's are set up filtering:

RB1 = project = test AND labels = 1
RB2 = project = test AND labels = 2

But then 3 issues are created with labels
TST-1 label = 1
TST-2 label = 1 2
TST-3 label = 2

When RB1 has started a sprint with TST-1 and TST-2 there's no obvious way on RB2 that the issue TST-2 is stuck in the sprint disallowing a new sprint to be started, unless going to the work mode.

With more issues coming in then this problem becomes more difficult to solve in work mode.


Along with that please make it clear to the user why these sprints are locked up, Atlassian Support has noticed that this process here is not inherently understood in the product.
fields.summary: Allow users to see more clearly the overlapping cases in RB's locked into sprints in Plan Mode

fields.description:
*Current Scenario*
# RapidBoard enabled on GreenHopper
# All issues will have the buttons "Rapid Board" and "Rank to top" on the Issue View

*Problem*
It causes some confusion for users that don't know what it means. We had to disable the Rapid Board module for the whole instance due to the complains of users that didn't want the buttons on the Issue View.

*Desirable*
Being able to enable Rapid Board (or its buttons) just for some projects, the same way you can do for GreenHopper.
fields.summary: As an Administrator, I would like to be able to enable RapidBoard just for some projects

fields.description:
We currently only see parent tasks in Plan and we can see parent tasks and subtasks in Work. But when we are planning and/or closing a Sprint, we can't see anything regarding Subtasks. We need to be able to see Subtasks and its estimation with Planning and Reporting...especially Reporting

Ex.
Parent Task -01
SubTask -02
SubTask -03
SubTask -04
...completed -02 and -03 during Sprint...once Sprint is closed...
Reports don't show anything - it looks as though nothing is completed, no work is done...

Need subtasks in rapidboards please...???

Dean
fields.summary: Scrum/Sprint Rapid Board - Ability to "Plan" and "Report" on sub-tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Scenario
User has a hierarchy of versions in his GreenHopper instance:
[PLANNING BOARD VIEW]
* Version A (Released)
** Version A.1 (Released)
** Version A.2 (Released)
* Version B 
** Version B.1 (Released)
** Version B.2 (Released)
** Version B.3

However, upon releasing *Version B.1*, it seems to be stacked below *Version A* in the Released Board:
[RELEASED BOARD VIEW]
* Project Overview
** Version B.2
* Version A
** Version A.1
** Version A.2
** Version B.1

h4. Investigation
Upon investigation and testing on a test instance, it seems that the order of the released sprints in the Released Board is related to the release dates of each sprint. Here's my testing phase:
[PLANNING BOARD VIEW]
* Version A (Release Date: 31/07/2012)
** Version A.1 (Release Date: 15/07/2012)
** Version A.2 (Release Date: 31/07/2012)
* Version B (Release Date: 15/08/2012)
** Version B.1 (Release Date: 15/07/2012)
** Version B.2 (Release Date: 01/08/2012)
** Version B.3 (Release Date: 15/08/2012)

Upon releasing the sprints in accordance to the date, I achieved the same status as what the customer experienced. *Version B.1* was grouped together with sprints from *Version A*. Releasing *Version B.2* does not exhibit the same stacking.

!Selection_049.png!
_Image showing the unexpected grouping_

!Selection_048.png!
_Image showing the ungrouped, released child version._

h4. Findings and Thoughts
What I can conclude from this is that whenever the release date for a sprint (referring to *Version B.1*) is before or having the same release date as other sprints (referring to *Version A*), then it would be grouped together with that sprint; regardless of whether the sprint has a parent version (referring to *Version B*) with a date further than a parent version which is released (referring to *Version A*).

h4. Assumptions
To be frank, I don't know whether to classify this as a bug or an expected behaviour; from what I see, the sprint *Version B.1* should not be grouped together with other sprints, as it is an independant sprint by itself. With versions in GreenHopper actioning differently than JIRA's methodology of handling versions (GreenHopper has parent-child versions, whereas JIRA treats all versions as independent ones), I see this as a minor defect in GreenHopper.
fields.summary: Released Child Versions Appeared Grouped With Unrelated Parent Version in Released Board

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Place the sprint bar underneath the stories and tasks and press the start sprint button.
# A Dialogue pops up prompting to set the start and end dates of the sprints. *If you don't change the dates*, it works fine. However, *if you choose a different date*, it returns a date in an unusable format and won't let you proceed. 

So, the only way to use this method is by using the default 2 week cycle.

{color:red}Update{color}

Here are my observations:
Upon uploading customer's data, settings were as follows:

*Advanced Settings*
* jira.date.picker.java.format = MM/dd/yyyy
* jira.date.picker.javascript.format = %m/%d/%y
* jira.date.time.picker.java.format = MM/dd/yy hh:mm a
* jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format= %b/%e/%y %I:%M %p

*Look and Feel*
* Complete date/time format = MM/dd/yy hh:mm a
* Day/month/year format = MM/dd/yyyy

# I navigated to the Rapid Board and selected 20 issues for a sprint.
# I clicked "Start Sprint" and a popup window appears.
# I clicked the calendar and set the sprint for a month's time instead of two weeks*(did not manually type this in)*
# The following error comes up(check jirabug.jpg)

* Note: Upon reverting all time formats back to default, the sprint works fine, even when using the calendar.
fields.summary: Calendars only respect default date entry

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you use the "View on Board" function it will display you all Rapid Boards where an issue can be located.
However, if that issue had been closed without being part of any sprint before, that function simply displays Plan mode but doesn't show that requested issue.
It's fine that closed issues mustn't be listed in Plan mode. However, the "View on Board" function should display the "There are no boards which contain this issue." error message instead if there's nothing to be shown in Plan mode.
fields.summary: "View on Board" function doesn't work properly for closed issues

fields.description:
Drag & drop issues/cards in GreenHopper taskboard is broken (the process keeps spinning) with JIRA 5.1.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as at July 10 2012| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#49BD5F| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We are actively working on this issue and expect to have a fix for the next release to OnDemand which is due to happen this weekend (i.e by Monday 16th of July)

*Workarounds*

Several workarounds are available. Pick the one that suits you best.

* Submit a [support request|https://support.atlassian.com] and and an engineer will upgrade GreenHopper on your OnDemand instance to a fixed version.
* Perform the transition 'manually' using the JIRA view.
* Use keyboard shortcuts as described in [the comments|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5437?focusedCommentId=324765&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-324765].
{panel}

fields.description:
In different views, the assignee can be changed. E.g. in planning board,
List view. If i click in the field/area, where the assignee is in, this
area changes to edit mode. If i now click on the name (or the word
"unassigned") a drop down listbox shows up with a list of names.

If now, i click on a particular name, two things happen:
1. the screen scrolls to top of page. I manually have to scroll down to
the place, where i want to change the assignee.
2. The name, where i click on will NOT be copied to the assignee field
3. I have to click again on the name. Now it will be copied to the
assignee field.

Please fix this issue.

Note- this mostly happens for issues (like more then 20) in one sprint.
fields.summary: Changing Assignee requires two clicks on the name

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the Sprint data is stored in a server timezone specific way, thus backing up the data and restoring it on a server with different timezone results in Sprint start/end/completion dates to be wrong. This can also result in the grey guideline in the Burndown chart appearing incorrectly - it can look like it is "lost". For example it will show purely on the x-axis instead of crossing over from y to x.

Either store the values in UTC millis since epoch or use Date column type (to be validated whether this solves the problem correctly).

h3. Workaround

In order to restore the times back to their last known working form, the below process can be used for the new server:

# Generate an XML backup from the previous server, or obtain the last-known working one and copy it to the new JIRA server.
# Schedule a downtime window.
# Stop the new JIRA server.
# Either:
#* Set the JVM timezone argument, e.g.: {{-Duser.timezone=GMT}}, as in [Setting Timezone in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+Timezone+in+JIRA].
#* Change the System Time of the server that the JVM is running on (the JVM will default to that time).
# Start the new JIRA server.
# Import the XML backup from the previous server.
# Test the charts and JIRA.

If the server is unable to be rolled back, the below can be followed, however this is not the recommend method and may cause additional problems due to time inconsistencies.

# Schedule a downtime window.
# Export the XML backup.
# Stop JIRA.
# Either:
#* Set the JVM timezone argument, e.g.: {{-Duser.timezone=GMT}}, as in [Setting Timezone in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+Timezone+in+JIRA].
#* Change the System Time of the server that the JVM is running on (the JVM will default to that time).
# Start JIRA.
# Import the XML backup.
# Test the charts and JIRA.
fields.summary: Restoring Sprint data in a different server timezone broken

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If an issue has several changes to its story points field before starting a sprint, the chart and report are supposed to show the last changed-to value. Due to this bug this is not always the case.

Example:
SP field changed from 3 -> 6, then 6 -> 8, then 8 -> 3, then the Sprint is started. Naturally 3 SP should show up on both, the burndown and the report. Currently this isn't always the case, so 6 or 8 or even no value could be shown.

This bug applies to statistic value burndowns, but not to the hour burndown chart.
fields.summary: Rapid Board Burndown Chart and Sprint Report show older story point field value

fields.description:
As a user I can do a JQL search for Custom Field "Sprint" name, rather than ID

Currently in JIRA 5.6 and GreenHopper 5.10.3  when doing a JQL search for a Rapid Board Sprint those are done by id numbers eg: *Sprint = 1* it would be best to have this as a per name basis eg: *Sprint = "sprint 2"* 
This would likely call for unique sprint names however.

Along with this as a user I would like to do historical JQL sprint searching eg: *Sprint was "sprint 2"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Two related cases:

* After using st or sb, the next issue is selected for you. However, when you subsequently perform a shift-select to select an issue range the wrong starting point is used (it's the last issue which you selected with your mouse, not the one selected after using st/sb)

* Similarly, using j or k to traverse a column does not updated the last selected issue, which also breaks shift select.
fields.summary: Multi-select broken by keyboard shortcuts

fields.summary: Ability to have one sprint active per Agile board even if they are in the same project

fields.summary: Need a feature to attach retrospective notes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Need an ability to see all the sprints. A product company needs to have multiple sprints sometimes with different timeframes to meet deadline. Having ability to putup a calendar of Sprints and possible with some text message will be useful for executives to review Sprint plans and focus areas from planning perspective.
fields.summary: Need ability to view all the sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Adding issues to the current active sprint in greenhopper is a hassle.
We need to find in plan mode and rank it to the top and only than drag it to the current active sprint - it can be very frustrating.

Regarding the location of the buttun within the issue page we would like to have one of the foloowing:
1. An action button just like we have Workflow actions within the issue page
2. It can sit down next to the link "View in rapid board".

We would also like to see it in the plan mode as an action at the right hand panel (after clikcing the Options drop-down menu).
fields.summary: We would like to have the Action button "Add to active sprint" within the issue page and in Plan mode within Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currenlty GH seems to lack a way to see the total work estimate AGAINST the work time available in a sprint. I think this information would be handy to have in both Plan and Work modes. 

1) In the Plan mode, as I move the grey Sprint Maker up and down to determine the the amount of work to assign in the sprint I'm planning for, it would be useful to have the total amount of time available for the sprint shown somewhere on the screen, that way I can do the planning work more quickly and intuitively. Pretty much like what the Statistics bar lets us do in the Planning Board. 

2) Then in the Work mode, while each issue block has its original estimate shown, nowhere shown is the total amount of those estimate time nor the remaining time left within the current sprint. 

I know scrum resists midstream changes, but things do change for us anyway, so this will information facilitate us to respond quickly at least..
fields.summary: Making total estimate time and remaining Sprint time available in Rapid Board Scrum

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a chart to measure the average speed up to a certain date of a sprint.

Let's suppose there is a sprint of 5 days for a total of 150 story points. 
At the end of the third day the team has burned a total of 75 story points. To measure the average speed we would consider the following formula: 75burned story points/3days. For us the average of our team is 25 x story points per day

A gadget or a chart to represent this value in JIRA would be of great value.
fields.summary: Gadget/Chart to measure the average speed per sprint up to a certain date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I need the ability to see issues in the Backlog on a per user basis when doing the sprint planning with a Scrum Rapid Board. Having a quick filter where I can type the name of the user is a solution that would work.

The developers (users) on the project are very specialized, and most of the issues are pre-assigned outside of the sprint planning.

This will allow me to address all the issues assigned to a given developer at once, rather than jumping from developer to developer during the planning meeting.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
# Have a fresh installation of JIRA 5.0.6 running.
# From the Dashboard, locate the Admin Gadget and click on the GreenHopper link to install it straight from the Dashboard rather than the UPM. The pop up installation will be displayed.
# Plugin will be installed properly but when validating the license key, it will show the attached error page.

*Side note*
The error will not occur if the link is opened in a new tab since it redirects to the UPM rather than coming up with the pop up installation.

*Workaround*
Install the GreenHopper plugin from the UPM rather than the link.
fields.summary: GreenHopper License Key validation results to java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For our product, we need to arrange the backlog as following:

Epic, User stories and sub-user stories. 


Currently GH supports only 3 levels of hierarchy - Epic, Story and Tasks. This request is to extend the stories hierarchy for more than 3 levels and table view provding required visualization to view the user-stories and sub-userstories.

Without support for nesting of user stories, it is difficult to use Greenhopper.
fields.summary: Story Hierarchy support in Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Tab should jump to the next column title not to the footer

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Given that we already force-rank stories in a Backlog.
And we estimate story points.
We should be able to provide a per-sprint, story point "Velocity" and have GreenHopper automatically plan sprints with tickets by walking down the backlog.

As changes are made to the backlog, these sprints should be re-planned automatically, rather than requiring manual effort to move stories in and out of sprints.

To get an idea how this should work, look at Pivotal Tracker.  While their tool has a long way to go for Enterprise use, they've done a good job of making backlogs and sprints almost manage themselves.  The contents of sprints will change many times to adapt to changing requirements and circumstances, as reflected in a well-maintained backlog.  

With all GH's additional data and configurability, GH could automate sprint planning even better than Pivotal Tracker does, reducing the effort required to just maintaining a solid backlog.

Further, once there has been some progress down a backlog, it is possible for GreenHopper to calculate our velocity empirically, replacing our manual "default" velocity with a more justifiable, data-driven number.

I had to write a Jira plugin to provide us with Velocity, Iteration Views, and Release prediction, but I'm not asking for any of that for now.  It just seems silly to have to manually drag stories around to "create" sprints.  

Sprints will occur in reality, whether we construct them in GreenHopper or not.  Let's make it so those sprints are both planned and tracked automatically, just by having a backlog and burning it down.  :)
fields.summary: Please plan sprints automatically

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The top Agile menu option shows up all the time even when all the projects that the user has access to are not enabled in Greenhopper. This option should be hidden in this case.
fields.summary: Agile option shows up for not enabled projects in Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Without being able to see Story Points, Assignee, and Labels, for example, it's difficult to make decisions involving trade-offs between level of effort, or to see when certain needs are not met, which we track using labels.
fields.summary: Please add the ability to customize the card layout on the Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a GreenHopper and Jira user I need to be able to use the Component View in GreenHopper so that I can see issues related to a component, and organise the various components in my project.

This is not possible when using a cascading select custom field in place of the built in components field - as per Atlassian recommendation - as a work around for JRA-846.
fields.summary: Option for Component View / Project Components to be pulled from a cascading select custom field.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Card Styles screen does not give the ability to control all fields on the new card screen. In our case, the reporter fields must not be changed - ie. the user must not be able to create an issue in another persons name (this can give us problem during securityrevision). There is no clue in the history/activity of the user creating the issue (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4618). Because this issue is not resolved, we need to remove the reporter field. That can be done in the normal JIRA screen, but not in the GH create screen. Is there a workaround for this? I can see that I can remove all customfields.
Another note is, why is the view card setup linked to the create card? that is silly. In the card view we want more info than on the create screen.
fields.summary: As project admin, I need to control the New Card fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Previously our approach to the issue operations shown in the Detail View cog has been to blacklist the ones we don't want, and allow the rest in the original order as they appear.

We don't want operations coming from plugins to interfere with how GreenHopper is used. So we need to change the approach to promote GH/JIRA sanctioned operations first before plugin provided ones.
fields.summary: Only show issue operations that GreenHopper cares about for the Detail View cog, in the order that GH cares about

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Work with the Bonfire team to start defining how they can plug in to GH

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
GreenHopper, in my opinion, bases too many things on the creation date of records, and the current date, in ways that can't be overridden.

These issues become apparent if you try to create and "run" a demo project.

If I create a project version in the past, tasks that are created after the version start date are excluded from the original estimate. In other words, GH automatically classes them as "new scope". But if I'm creating all of the information after the fact, there's no way to actually know that. Making such critical decisions FOR the user based on a (frankly arbitrary) datum such as a record creation date is far too limiting. (Perhaps the ability to mark the task as either "original" or "added". This gets to the overall issue of scope management in GH, as GHS-1288 for example).

But if I try to create my demo project by creating versions/sprints, tasks and worklogs in the future, the burndown chart won't show this data, apparently because it "hasn't happened yet." Again, IMO, a case of the tool trying to do too much based on whatever the current date happens to be.

I think the tool needs to worry less about enforcing any particular view of how things "should" be, and simply reflect the way they ARE according to the data that's been entered. Of course, where the data are ambiguous, the tool may need to ask for some additional info (like whether a task is "original" or "added").
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I would like to be able to back-date or forward-date any project activity

fields.description:
In our project, we have a version with 14 tickets. One of them is in progress and the other tickets are already closed. Some of the closed tickets have a "Remaining Time" greater than zero, because JIRA does not automatically set it to zero when a ticket is closed.

The statistics for this version is not correct in the Planning Board. The sums for "Time Spent"always show 0 "minutes". This bug should be fixed.
fields.summary: "Time Remaining" is always "0 minutes"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We would like to have an option to notify (email) selected JIRA users upon changes of the Rank field of any issue. 

My BA team requires constant monitoring of the backlog (planning board of the unscheduled version) in order to know if there are issues that are not analyzed, which are re-ordered by the PO and possibly became a priority.

Ideally, the result should be an email saying that the Rank of one (or more) issues has been modified. We are not interested in which issues, but rather if any issue has it's Rank value modified.
fields.summary: Notifications on Rank field modification

1) It would be nice to have more granularity around the column WIP limit. i.e. We only want 2 features in construction and 9 other tickets (stories, bugs, etc).
If either a) set multiple WIP limits for "groups" of issue types, b) exclude issue types from my wip limit that would really help.

It would be convince for users to have the ability to remove the sprint reports from previous sprints on that created rapid board. 

At the moment, the only way to remove these reports is to remove the rapid board all together.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# By default there is a default rank field named _Rank_ 
# Add another customfield type Global Rank named _Rank-1_
# *Rank issue manually from Planning Board(both Rank and Rank-1) is working fine*
# Try to rank issue using Rank to Top using _Rank_ is working fine
# Try to rank issue using *Rank to Top using _Rank-1_ is not working*

*Expected Behavior*: as both _Rank_ and _Rank-1_ can be used to Rank issue in planning board. _Rank-1_ should be working with Rank to Top features.

*Workaround*: This behavior is not reproducible using Rapid Board. The Rank to Top features is working for both Rank fields.
fields.summary: Rank to Top/Down doesn't work with other Global Rank field in Planning Board
